intro: Astragalus hamosus var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in dense, globular inflorescences, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with numerous small leaflets arranged along the stem. This species is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
